snippet.textDisplay: His report directly conflicts with the flight data... The helicopter did not hover... it actually geared up to gain altitude and then descended into the hills. Not everyone has had a helicopter flying over them that close, but living in California you do get used to it.. so I do believe he has a general sense of what they would sound like up close but I’m just noting that this conflicts with the initial reports of the flight path and the data that was provided

  KOBE BRYANT'S CRASH RECORDED ON "NEST CAMERA VIDEO" >>>>. SAD!.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9CWmxm1udOU       These last seconds had to have been so extremely scary that I bet everyone was praying to be Saved by Jesus!

snippet.textDisplay: This witness came on the scene wearing a TWA cap. Stating that he was unable to see the helicopter. However, he went on to speculate that the helicopter was moving above the parking lot @   3 to 5 miles per hour. He proceeded by speculating that he was unable to see any (helicopter fog depression) in the fog itself. One might need some type of training to notice " helicopter fog depression" in a fog. So, this really means that he was not exactly sure of the exact location of the helicopter. Finally, he also said that the helicopter that was never in plain sight, managed to make a (left turn) going at 3 to 5 miles an hour. He also speculated that this helicopter crashed 45 seconds later,flying at the speed of 3 to 5 miles an hour,  more than one mile away into the mountains. Also,claiming to hear the sound of ( fiber glass crashing). This is all speculations. It is impossible for any helicopter to travel over one mile, in 45 seconds,moving  @ 3 to 5 miles an hour.  So, he is asking us to believe that he can hear the helicopter crashing one mile away, adjacent to the freeway, making a noise like (fiber glass crashing). This witness is not an expert on say ( helicopter fog depression). This witness was unable to see this helicopter making a left turn either. Because,the  helicopter was never in view. The bottom line is that this witness never saw this helicopter. It is unfair to the public for anyone to pause as an expert on (helicopter fog depression). It is a highly complicated,and technical subject to learn.Therefore, many comments made by this witness were based on speculations. Undoubtedly, there is a mixture of facts and fictions in this eye witness account. Please, proceed with caution.

Undoubtedly, there is a mixture of facts and fictions in this eye witness account. Please, proceed with caution.
